alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Harnett, northeastern Lee, southwestern Wake and southeastern Chatham Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Fuquay-Varina, or 13 miles northeast of Sanford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Crosswinds Boating Center and New Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Strong winds may occur well ahead of any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
